title: Etiquetas perdidas
content:
Buenos días, Hoy después de que se me apagara el ordenador de repente, al abrir de nuevo Thunderbird he observado que se han perdido las etiquetas que había en los correos desde una fecha (hace un mes) ¿Hay alguna manera de recuperarlas?

Un saludo
creator: nhernando

title: Email SMTP log on to IMAP server.
content:
Hi there Folks, YES I donate every year, been using TB for, maybe since it started. Recently have had a number of serious security incidents !. In writing this suggestion/request, may I as an Older person suggest in your HELP, you have a "Wish List" !. In looking thru lots of themes & apps nothing equates to what I would like and maybe many others. Wish No 1. TB powers up in "Offline" mode, (DEFAULT ). ALL Systems, Windows/Linux. Wish No 2. Enable H/W interrupt to stop programme immediately if conconcerned ! ( suggest Cntrl/Return ) Wish No 3. Download messages into main email folder with subject line, Then "STOP" !. In UK I use BT IMAP as main server, I have several email folders with different passwords. Recently on TB ver 102.10 Win10 64bit. SMTP will not link to server, checked out passwords & direct on BT, ALL OK. This time I set "Pasword Manager" box ! since then NO problems (YET ). This leads me to believe we have a BUG/Corruption of password when using SMTP without "Password Manager" ?. No doubt SMTP picks up paswords from different places, Ie " Profile " or " Password Manager " Wish No 4. LETS GET SOME COLOUR !!! I would like to have "Sub Main Domains". These "Sub Main Domains" could have a choice of different colours, which would help other folk to use TB easier, also resize for poor eyesight, maybe a good little marketing statement ? These Sub Main Domains wlii not allow data entry but if clicked will bring up option "Create New Sub Folder".

I hope you find my wish List of interest. There are are several others, so I await your response. Rgds Gordon. Stay Safe.
creator: rugbyguy1

title: Thunderbird contribution
content:
I responded to the request from Thunderbird for contributions. I used Paypal to make my contribution but ended up not completing the transactrion because you required my mailing address for me to complete. I see no reason for Mozilla to have my mailing address - I was providing a valid email address. I will contribute when the requirement to provide my mailing address is removed. I am a long time Thunderbird user and would like to support your work but see no reason for the need to provide my address info. I attempted to find a way to contact staff directly bvut this seems to be the only way to communicate.

H Berryman ScottishTerrier@att.net

title: Přizpůsobení lišty nabídek
content:
Dobrý den, ahoj, po aktulizaci nechutně neprakticky překopali hlavní nabídku a vůbec možnost administrace. Rozdělení na dvě části. Zbytečně zabírá dva řádky, přitom by mohlo být vše v jedné lajně. Proč mění to, co skvěle fungovalo. Existuje nějaký doplněk na lepší administraci, vítě někdo?

Např. používám ale jen občas rychlý filtr. Mám ho vypnutý. Ale při každém novém startu se mi aktivuje. Používal jsem tlačítko označit, kdy stačilo kliknout, zpráva se stala nepřečtenou nebo přečtenou. Nyní vyběhne roletka. Zbytečně klik navíc. Používám tedy písmeno M.

Máte někdo k tomu postřehy, řešíte také někdo?

Díky

title: How to stop server from checking for a folder that has been removed?
content: One of the 3 email accounts I have configured on Thunderbird is a personal gmail account. I was doing some cleanup over the weekend and deleted an unnecessary folder from that account. I probably should have deleted it directly using the gmail web interface. But then again that shouldn't be necessary assuming IMAP syncing is working correctly. Anyway, I now get periodic popups from Thunderbird stating it can't find the folder that I removed. So why is the server still trying to manage a folder that I have manually removed? And how do I stop the annoying popups from appearing? If you need the exact popup message I will capture it next time and update this post. TIA
creator: calgarylocalguy

creator: russb

title: email message can be searched but not browsed to.
content:
I'm about to retreat to Outlook. I can't keep ahead of all the data corruption issues with Thunderbird.

Initial behavior: 1. An email is known to have been received at some point in the past. I can remember a unique keyword which we will call "Hidar" exists in the message. 2. Searching for the message finds it, but when I try to view it an empty message appears.

Found many forum posts stating the same issue over the years (one from the previous day), suggesting this means the indexing database is bad. Corrective action is to delete and leave Thunderbird reindex. I complete that over about 24 hours.

New behavior 1. An email is known to have been received at some point in the past. I can remember a unique keyword which we will call "Hidar" exists in the message. 2. Searching for the message finds it, and when clicking on it, it will now open the email. It states the email exists in the folder "Inbox". 3. Opening the folder Inbox does not locate this message. Sorting by data and scrolling to the date given for the email reveals it is not there.

Is there a way to make this email message that is obviously still in Thunderbird's database browsable in the left bar folders again?

Is there anyway to find what other messages it has decided to hide?

Thank you.
creator: fwilson00

title: Can't Get Mail
content: I have been a Firefox user for well over ten years. On Friday I accessed my emails without any problem. However, this morning I could not. I checked with my service (sbcglobal.net) to confirm my password. I then went to the password manager on Firefox to see if it was the same and it was. But when I click "Get Messages" I get an error message "Sending of password for user drumfamily@sbcglobal.net did not succeed. Mail server pop.att.yahoo.com responded: [SYS/TEMP] Server error - Please try again later." I have tried this a number of times over two hours and still get this message. Any suggestions.
creator: drumfamily

title: Can't send or receive emails - server error
content: Am a Luddite running T/B 52.9.1 (32-bit) and windows xp. Tried to download emails from att.net and it said password might be compromised so change it. I did that and edited the password settings in T/B to change the password. Tried to download emails and got error message: "sending of password for user jobby@att.net did not succeed. Mail server inbound.att.net responded: server error. Please try again later." Have tried many times since w/o success. Then tried to send a test email (after editing password settings in T/B for outbound emails) and got error message: "Login to server outbound.att.net failed." It asked for new password, which I entered, but it still failed. If I go to the att website (https://currently.att.yahoo.com) and enter my new password I can see new emails on the server. Can't figure out why T/B can't connect to the att.net server. Any suggestions on how to fix would be much appreciated. Thank you. Joel Hornstein
creator: joelhornstein

title: Unsent messages prompt, but Outbox is empty. IMAP
content:
I saw someone else post about this problem but did not see any definitive resolution. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1376146

I just had the same thing happen. I started TB, entered my password, mail started downloading, then I get a prompt to re-enter my password to send unsent email. I didn't recall having left anything unsent so I checked the Outbox under the local folders, which was empty. I checked the Sent box as well to see if there was some kind of "pending" email listed there.

After I entered my password I re-checked the Sent box and a new Forwarded email had just been sent. Do pending emails not get put in the local Outbox when you are set up for IMAP? Is there some way to see that folder? I don't see another Outbox in the IMAP folders.

Thanks! =)

title: Work around for T-Bird wrong pdf viewer when in edit mode Bug 1698140
content:
Has anyone figured out a workaround on Mac platform for Bug 1698140 (if been unfixed for over two years):

Assume you have a draft email saved in the Drafts folder that has a PDF attachment.

If you open the draft email for simply viewing and click on the PDF attachment, it opens the attached file with Preview as expected.

If you open the draft email for editing and then click on the PDF attachment, it opens using firefox.

I'd like it to open in Preview in all cases (the viewing mode and in while editing.

Any ideas?
creator: jeffb4
